name: Drop-in Support Group for Collecting Behaviors (Hoarding Disorder)
description: MHASF Drop-in Support Group for Hoarding Behavior is a peer-led support group for those dealing with their own hoarding behaviors and challenges. A non-judgmental environment for individuals to share and get support from peers in an informal setting. REMOTE: First Four Thursdays (time varies) IN-PERSON: SECOND & FOURTH WEDNESDAY 3:00PM – 4:30PM
fullDescription: MHASF Drop-in Support Group for Hoarding Behavior is a peer-led support group for those dealing with their own hoarding behaviors and challenges. A non-judgmental environment for individuals to share and get support from peers in an informal setting. REMOTE: First Four Thursdays (time varies) IN-PERSON: SECOND & FOURTH WEDNESDAY 3:00PM – 4:30PM
whatTheyOffer: MHASF Drop-in Support Group for Hoarding Behavior is a peer-led support group for those dealing with their own hoarding behaviors and challenges. A non-judgmental environment for individuals to share and get support from peers in an informal setting. REMOTE: First Four Thursdays (time varies) IN-PERSON: SECOND & FOURTH WEDNESDAY 3:00PM – 4:30PM
howToGetIt: Send email to peersupportservices@mentalhealthsf.org. Complete the Participant Information Form: https://mentalhealthsf.formstack.com/forms/participant_information_form and review the Client Rights and Requirement document: https://www.mentalhealthsf.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/Client-Rights-Requirements.pdf
address: 870 Market Street, Suite 658, San Francisco, CA, 94102
agency: Mental Health Association of San Francisco (MHASF)
